body: Thanks for the tip, but this seems to cause the call stack to overflow…
Yea I don't really see the purpose of supporting this..

well. no. setting the default of an argument to the value of another argument probably isn't worth supporting.

but my suggestion should have worked, right?

Hmmm.  We actually used it heavily, e.g.

`.borderRadius (@radius: 4.5px, @radius2: @radius, @radius3: @radius, @radius4: @radius)`

which sets all corners to the same radius if not otherwise specified.  This pattern balances convenience and granularity.

I tried James’ solution on a production stylesheet (2500 lines and growing) and LESS.js bails citing a call stack overflow.  I need to make a reduced test case to see why.  Plus it works with the `less` gem.
Yeah, the inheritance works in lessphp.  We were using it with .border-radius() as well; awfully useful!

issue.title: blank parameters and define parameters with an other

body: This is an obvious win, IMO. If parameters are optional, then it should be possible to specify which ones I want to override.
